projects.name: PLAB2 Practice Platform
projects.summary_short: Built a full-stack real-time PLAB2 practice app with React, Spring Boot, and WebSockets for 500+ users.
projects.description: Real-time collaborative platform for medical exam preparation with role-based sessions and feedback.
projects.paragraph: Designed and built a full-stack real-time web application for PLAB 2 medical exam practice, where users assume Doctor, Patient, and Observer roles in simulated consultations. Implemented authentication, JWT-secured access control, session timers, randomized case generation, and structured feedback flows using Spring Boot with modular REST APIs and WebSocket messaging. Developed the client interface in React, TypeScript, Tailwind, and Material UI with attention to responsive layouts and basic accessibility. Configured PostgreSQL persistence with Flyway migrations and deployed via Render (backend) and Vercel (frontend), supporting 500+ users. Through iterative debugging, scaling, and usability improvements, gained hands-on experience with state synchronization, real-time messaging, UI feedback loops, and container-based deployment.

projects.name: Interview Coach AI

projects.description: AI-powered interview preparation app generating tailored questions with pinning and explanation features.
projects.paragraph: Developed a MERN-based AI platform that generates personalized interview questions using Googleâ€™s Gemini API, enabling users to practice and pin questions as they progress. Built secure authentication including email/password flows, JWT management, Google OAuth integration, and a modal-driven password reset experience to refine UX handling of multi-step states. Implemented core features for note-taking, progress tracking, and image upload through Multer while gaining experience in file handling and form validation. Structured the backend using Express and MVC patterns, deployed frontend on Vercel, and configured hosting for the API. Focused on creating clean, responsive UI components with TailwindCSS and Framer Motion while learning accessibility principles, error handling, and reliability considerations.
